title: Government Management of Private Estates Act, 1892
title_en: Government Management of Private Estates Act, 1892
description: Official consolidated text of Government Management of Private Estates Act, 1892 (X of 1892) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Title and extent.–(1) This Act may be called the Government Management of Private
provisions.content:
Estates Act, 1892.
[2(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.] ; 3*
3

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions.–In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,
provisions.content:
(l)         “immoveable property” includes land, buildings, hereditary allowances, rights
to ways, lights, ferries, fisheries or any other benefit to arise out of land, and
things attached to the earth or permanently fastened to anything which is
attached to the earth but not standing timber, growing crops or grass;
(2)         “gross income” includes all receipts of every kind in produce or cash, except
money borrowed, recoveries of principal and the proceeds of sale of
immoveable property or of moveable property properly classed as capital; and
(3)         “private estates under Government management” include–

(a)        estates under the Court of Wards;
(b)        encumbered estates under Government management;
(c)        estates attached for default of payment of Government revenue;
(d)        minors’ estates placed under the guardianship of a revenue-officer of
the Government by a Civil Court;
(e)        estates managed by a Collector in pursuance of any order made under
the 1[Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (Act V of 1908)] (XLV of 1882)
and
(f)        all other estates made over to or taken under the management of a
revenue- officer of the Government as such under any law for the time
being in force or in virtue of any agreement.

provisions.title: Section 3. Power to levy rate. It shall be lawful for the 2[Provincial Government]–
provisions.content:
(1)        to levy on all private estates under Government management a rate not
exceeding five percent on the gross income, calculated, as nearly as may be
possible, to cover
(a)        the cost of all Government establishments in so far as they may be
employed in the supervision or management of such estates other than
establishments specially entertained for the supervision or management
of any particular estate or group of estates, and
(b)        all contingent expenditure incurred in consequence of such supervision
or management;
(2)        from time to time to vary such rate; and
(3)        to reduce or remit such rate in any special case or cases as may be equitable:
Provided that, in deciding the amount of the rate to be levied under this Act on any particular
estate or group of estates, the 2[Provincial Government] shall consider the expenditure incurred on
special establishments for such estate or estates.

provisions.title: Section 4. Power to levy special charges. In cases where an officer of the Government is employed
provisions.content:
to give legal advice or to audit accounts on behalf of any estate, the 2[Provincial Government], if it
considers the services rendered to be of a special nature, may, in its discretion, direct a special charge
to be made against that estate on account of such services, irrespective of the rate leviable under the
last foregoing section.
1
Sub by Ord. XXVII of 1981, s.5 & Sch. IV (only to the extent of Islamabad Capital Territory).
2
Subs. by A. O., 1937, for “L. G.”.

provisions.title: Section 5. Saving as to special expenditure. Nothing in this Act shall apply to the cost of
provisions.content:
establishments specially entertained or to expenditure of any description specially incurred in respect
of any particular estate or estates.

provisions.title: Section 6. Validation of levy of past rates. All rates for general supervision or management levied
provisions.content:
by any 1[Provincial Government] before the commencement of this Act shall be deemed to have
been levied under this Act.

provisions.title: Section 7. Powers to make rules. The 1[Provincial Government] may make any rules2 and issue any
provisions.content: orders which may be necessary for carrying this Act into effect, and which are consistent therewith.

provisions.title: Section 8. Exemption from jurisdiction of Courts. Where any Government establishment is
provisions.content:
employed in such supervision as aforesaid, the 1[Provincial Government] shall be the sole judge of
the cost attributable to such employment, and its decision thereon shall not be questioned in any
Court of Law or otherwise.
